#BellLetsTalk about how doing things you enjoy is important, ESPECIALLY when you feel like you don't have enough time to enjoy "fun things"
#BellLetsTalk about how music can improve any situation
#BellLetsTalk about how amazing reading #HarryPotter makes me feel
#BellLetsTalk about how a gratitude journal/happiness journal can also help motivate you
#BellLetsTalk about how not reading the news for a few days because you're saddened by the state of humanity is okay
#BellLetsTalk about how many beautiful dogs there are out there that you still haven't met! https://t.co/nwq7QAKxSl
#BellLetsTalk about how hard it is to help a family member/close friend, but how important it is to try your hardest
#BellLetsTalk about how my inbox is ALWAYS open for you to talk to https://t.co/Vyvl8o3eT7
#BellLetsTalk about how online communities can foster support too (I'm looking at you @YouTube and @tumblr) ðŸ‘‰ðŸ½ðŸ•¶ðŸ‘‰ðŸ½
#BellLetsTalk about how I'm really (really) good at telling people I'm fine
#BellLetsTalk about how I'm not fully myself with everyone (even the people closest to me) which has impacted my mental health
#BellLetsTalk about a society of unlearning where we can talk and cry without feeling shame
#BellLetsTalk about seeing kids (uni students) hiding behind humour to pretend things are a-okay
#BellLetsTalk about how terrifying kids can fall into addiction when stress, pressure, and poor mental health are combined
#BellLetsTalk HOW MANY STUDENTS SUFFER FROM MENTAL HEALTH PROBLEMS
#BellLetsTalk about that panic-y feeling when you want to reach out, but can't form the words
#BellLetsTalk about how hard it is living 6000+ km from the some of the people you want to hug most
#BellLetsTalk about how finding others like you is SO important
#BellLetsTalk about how the approval of others can seem imposable to achieve but it's all you want
#BellLetsTalk about how fear also plays in to talking about mental health
but #BellLetsTalk about the adults who think mental health is a "cop out excuse" because you ran out of time to do your work
#BellLetsTalk about all the profs who actually get it and accommodate students' needs
